title: The Invasion of Time

goofs: In episode one, the Doctor is wearing his scarf when he meets the Vardans, but it's on the hat stand when he returns to the TARDIS and he's not wearing it.
What happens to the rest of the Sontaran fleet once Stor is killed?
Leela and Andred fall in love despite barely having looked at one another before.
Why is Leela allowed to go to Gallifrey (and stay there!) when Sarah wasn't?

additional_notes: David Agnew is a pseudonym for Graham Williams, Anthony Read, and David Weir
bottom_line: A work of desperation, 'The Invasion of Time' stands up reasonably well, although its basis in Gallifreyan lore requires the viewer to have seen (and remembered) 'The Deadly Assassin'. The main negative element is the Vardans (whose appearance, both assumed and real, is ludicrous). A knowing, post-modern feel is created when Tom Baker looks into camera and notes: 'Even the sonic screwdriver won't get me out of this one.'
